tit.e: Miko (phonetic alphabet of 皇子, Imperial Prince)
tit.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。（漢字についてはここでは触れていないのと、あえて説明する必要性がないため）

sen.j: 皇子（みこ、おうじ）とは、皇帝または天皇の男子を指す呼称である。
sen.e: Miko (phonetic alphabet of 皇子, also Oji) is the naming of sons of Kotei or Teno (Emperor).
Miko, also referred to as Oji is the naming of the sons of Kotei or Tenno (emperor).
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。「呼称」meaning→naming としました。Teno→Tenno と修正しました。
sen.e: Miko, also referred to as Oji is the naming of the sons of Kotei or Tenno (emperor).

sen.j: 国によって「親王」「郡王」「王」「大公」と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: The naming varies between countries like "Shino"(Imperial Prince), "Guno" (a second highest rank of the court rank in ancient China), "O"(King), and "Taiko"(Prince of the Russian Empire).

The naming varies between countries, such as "Shino"(Imperial Prince), "Guno" (a second highest rank of the court rank in ancient China), "O"(King), and "Taiko"(monarchs of the European minor countries).
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。スペースを修正しました。like→such as,「大公」のカッコ部分を修正しました。
sen.e: The naming varies between countries, such as "Shino"(Imperial Prince), "Guno" (a second highest rank of the court rank in ancient China), "O"(King), and "Taiko"(monarchs of the European minor countries).

sen.j: これに対して女子を皇女という。
sen.e: Meanwhile, daughters of Emperor are named Himemiko (phonetic alphabet of 皇女, Imperial Princess).
Meanwhile, the daughters of the emperors are named Himemiko (imperial princess).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。Emperor→emperors,カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the daughters of the emperors are named Himemiko (imperial princess).
Nippon (Japan)
Japan
sen.cmt: Nippon を削除しました。（日本語での読みは必要ないと判断しました）
sen.e: Japan

sen.j: もともとは、ヤマト王権の時代に有力豪族の子弟をさして広く「みこ」と称されていた。
sen.e: Originally, "Miko" was a phonetic naming widely referred to children of Gozoku (local ruling family) in Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty).
Originally, 'Miko' was used widely referring to the children and younger brothers of Gozoku (local ruling family) in the period of the Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty).
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。「子弟＝子や弟、年少者」として修正しました。a phonetic naming widely referred→used widely referring と修正しました。the, period of を補いました。
sen.e: Originally, 'Miko' was used widely referring to the children and younger brothers of Gozoku (local ruling family) in the period of the Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty).

sen.j: しかし、次第に大王 (ヤマト王権)の子弟を指すようになり、天皇の成立とともに皇子の字があてられるようになった。
sen.e: However, it gradually became to refer to children of Okimi (great king) of Yamato sovereignty, and upon the establishment of Emperor, 皇子, the character of Miko, started to be used for the naming.

However, it gradually came to refer to the children and younger brothers of Okimi (great king) of the Yamato sovereignty, and upon the establishment of the emperor, 皇子, the character of Miko, started to be used for the naming.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 became→came,children→children and younger brothers,Emperor→emperor と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: However, it gradually came to refer to the children and younger brothers of Okimi (great king) of the Yamato sovereignty, and upon the establishment of the emperor, 皇子, the character of Miko, started to be used for the naming.

sen.j: 日本書紀によれば、大化の改新の折に蘇我蝦夷が誅された理由に、自身の子を「みこ」と尊称させるなどの不遜があったことなどが理由のひとつとして見える。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki"(Chronicles of Japan), it seems to be one of the reasons why Soga no Emishi was put to death penalty on the occasion of the Taika Reforms (Great Reformation of the Taika Era) that he committed an irreverent error to make his children called with the honorific naming "Miko".

According to Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), it seems to be one of the reasons why Soga no Emishi was executed on the occasion of the Taika Reforms (Great Reformation of the Taika era) that he was conceited to make his children called with the honorific naming 'Miko.'
sen.cmt: クォーツを削除しました。スペースを修正しました。put on death penalty→executed,Era→era,committed an irreverent error→was conceited,クォーツの修正、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), it seems to be one of the reasons why Soga no Emishi was executed on the occasion of the Taika Reforms (Great Reformation of the Taika era) that he was conceited to make his children called with the honorific naming 'Miko.'

sen.j: しかし、天皇の子女の身位として親王や内親王が定着すると、特定の皇族子女の呼称としての皇子や皇女は使用されなくなった。
sen.e: Yet, Miko and Himemiko stopped to be used as the naming of specific Imperial children, once Shino and Naishino (Imperial Princess) established as the appellation of standing of the Imperial children.

Yet, Miko and Himemiko became no longer used as the naming of specific imperial children, once Shino and Naishino (imperial princess) became established as the appellation for the children of the emperors.
sen.cmt: stopped to→became no longer,Imperial→imperial と修正しました。カッコ内を修正しました。became を補いました。appellation of standing of→appellation for,Imperial children→children of the emperors と修正しました。
sen.e: Yet, Miko and Himemiko became no longer used as the naming of specific imperial children, once Shino and Naishino (imperial princess) became established as the appellation for the children of the emperors.

sen.j: 但し、天皇の男子一般を皇子と呼ぶ習慣は残り、第一皇子、第二皇子、第一皇女というように、天皇との続柄を指す場合に多用されるようになった。
sen.e: But it remained as customs to generally call Imperial sons Miko and then the naming became often used to refer to their relationship with Emperor like the first Miko, the second Miko, or the first Himemiko.

But it remained as customs to generally call the emperors' sons Miko, and then the naming became often used to refer to their relationship with the emperors such as the first Miko, the second Miko, or the first Himemiko.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。Imperial sons→Emperors' sons （”天皇の”とあるので）,Emperor→emperors,like→such as と修正しました。
sen.e: But it remained as customs to generally call the emperors' sons Miko, and then the naming became often used to refer to their relationship with the emperors such as the first Miko, the second Miko, or the first Himemiko.

sen.j: 現代においても、一般的な用語としては用いられないが、皇居において天皇の子女の部屋を皇子室というように、皇子の呼称が使用される例も散見される。
sen.e: Although Miko is not used as a general term at present, there are some cases to use the naming of Miko here and there like the Miko room to refer to the room for Imperial children at the Imperial Palace.

Although Miko is not used as a general term at present, there are some cases to use the naming of Miko here and there, such as the Miko room to refer to the room for the children of the emperor at the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。カンマを補いました。like→as,Imperial children→the children of the emperor と修正しました。
sen.e: Although Miko is not used as a general term at present, there are some cases to use the naming of Miko here and there, such as the Miko room to refer to the room for the children of the emperor at the Imperial Palace.
China
China
China
Europe
Europe
Europe
Aum Shinrikyo
Aum Shinrikyo
Aum Shinrikyo

sen.j: オウム真理教では、麻原彰晃の息子にオウム真理教の階級として「皇子（こうし）」なる称号を授与していた。
sen.e: Aum Shinrikyo bestowed on sons of Shoko ASAHARA a title of Koshi (another phonetic alphabet of 皇子, Imperial son) as a rank of Aum Shinrikyo.
Aum Shinrikyo bestowed on the sons of Shoko ASAHARA the title of Koshi (imperial son), as a rank of Aum Shinrikyo.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。a→the,カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: Aum Shinrikyo bestowed on the sons of Shoko ASAHARA the title of Koshi (imperial son), as a rank of Aum Shinrikyo.
